subject: RE: [junit] HowTo build a WebGUIRunner?
msgSnippet: Servus, I wouldn t build my own, I ld set up CruiseControl (http://cruisecontrol.sourceforge.net/) -- Erik Meade             emeade@objectmentor.com Senior
messageBody:
Servus,

I wouldn't build my own, I'ld set up CruiseControl
(http://cruisecontrol.sourceforge.net/)

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Wolfgang Egger [mailto:beuys@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 13, 2001 2:31 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] HowTo build a WebGUIRunner?
>
>
> Servus,
>
> I have to test a distributed "WebDriven" application. Therefor I use
> JUnit in conjuntion with HttpUnit. Until now I run the tests with the
> junit.textui.TestRunner within an endless loop.
>
> As a next step I want every programmer being able to see the
> testResults, so that they can see what they produce, even if the don't
> code their own UnitTests:-)
>
> So I have to build my own TestRunner that is running in a webBrowser.
> Is there any documentation besides the sources themself, so that I can
> see how to run and evaluate the tests?
>
> Thanx in advance
>
> Wolfgang Egger
